node.title: They Fell for Each Other Over a Fall Lunch
node.description: Angela Schiller set low stakes when she agreed to meet Robert Swift for an outdoor brown bag lunch.
node.content: ["Angela Schiller and Robert Swift first noticed each other in August 2015 at a Black Faculty and Staff Caucus function hosted by Kennesaw State University near Atlanta.", "Ms. Schiller, 45, was running late and found a seat in the back of the room. Surveying the space, she spotted Mr. Swift and instantly felt a connection. \u201cIt was a feeling that I had never experienced before,\u201d she said, adding: \u201cnot in this immediate way.\u201d", "As the event went on, she kept sneaking glances his way. \u201cWhen it was over, I felt like I was on a carousel of handshakes and nice-to-meet-yous,\u201d she said. \u201cThen Robert suddenly appeared before me. I couldn\u2019t stop smiling, but I wanted to play it cool. I was just getting out of a long-term relationship and wasn\u2019t planning on getting into anything anytime soon, but something about Robert made me want to stay open.\u201d", "Mr. Swift, 46, had noticed Ms. Schiller, too, and knew he had to find a way to approach her. \u201cI\u2019m a shy person, but something about Angela made me know that I couldn\u2019t leave that room before introducing myself,\u201d he said. \u201cMy initial impression of her was that she was not only beautiful, but also very down to earth, pleasant and funny.\u201d", "After their first encounter, Mr. Swift sent Ms. Schiller weekly emails, asking how she was doing and letting her know he was thinking about her.", "[Click here to binge read this week\u2019s featured couples.]", "\u201cThis really intrigued me,\u201d said Ms. Schiller, who earned a bachelor\u2019s degree from the University of California, Santa Cruz, a master\u2019s degree in Africana studies and social and cultural analysis from N.Y.U. and a Ph.D. in theater and performance studies from Stanford. She is now the director of arts education for the nonprofit ArtsBridge Foundation in Atlanta.", "Mr. Swift has a bachelor\u2019s degree in business and organizational communication and a master\u2019s degree in education from the University of Akron. He works as an instructional designer at Kennesaw State University.", "About a month and a half after they met, he invited her to lunch. Not sure of his intentions, she suggested that they make it a brown bag lunch outside where they could enjoy the beautiful fall Atlanta weather \u2014 something low key and low stakes.", "It turned out to be a two-hour meal and life-changing for both of them. They talked about their families, their past, their dreams and more. \u201cWe laughed a lot and that was a good sign for me,\u201d said Ms. Schiller. \u201cI walked away feeling amazing and that I wanted to spend every day in his company.\u201d", "Mr. Swift said he \u201chad a feeling that she liked me when she gave me a hug before she left.\u201d", "They continued to see each other and in 2018 the two moved in together.", "As they started putting the pieces together on how to or even whether to get married during a global pandemic, Ms. Schiller\u2019s mother, who is retired and lives in California, noted that state\u2019s catastrophic wildfires, heat waves and droughts, telling them, \u201cLife is short. Don\u2019t wait. Go for it.\u201d", "They became engaged in September 2021 and were married Oct. 22 before 25 friends and family members at the Southern Gentleman, a restaurant in Atlanta. Dawn V. Eskridge, a Universal Life Church minister, officiated.", "They asked their guests to be fully vaccinated before the event. Masks were optional for the outdoor ceremony, for which candles were arranged into a circle to serve as a makeshift altar.", "\u201cThe moment Angela arrived at the altar, the gravity of what was happening became surreal,\u201d Mr. Swift said. \u201cAngela was absolutely stunning. I was falling in love with her all over again.\u201d", "\u201cWhen I saw Robert standing at the altar, it reminded me of the first time I laid eyes on him,\u201d Ms. Schiller said, adding: \u201cIt\u2019s amazing how one day someone walks into your life, and suddenly you can\u2019t remember how you lived without him.\u201d"]
